gov.usgs.anss.msread

Class RawDiskBigBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.msread.RawDiskBigBuffer

  • public class RawDiskBigBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class present a block oriented read/write for the RandomAccessFile class. It basically adds methods which insure read/write on 512 byte boundaries. It does so by using a 'big' prefetched buffer that moves through the file at the users command and allows block orient read requests against that buffer. Read request outside of the buffer wait until the user advances the buffer to include the blocked request. This is mainly used by AnalyzeDiskFile to look at Edge files efficiently (see that process for more details on the implementation). 1) Create one of these setting a buffer siez 2) Create threads which are reading blocks and moving up through a file 3) Have a method to determine all of the threads are blocked waiting for more data from this file 4) When that happens, cause the next section to be read using nextBuffer 5) continue until end of disk is reached with steps 3, 4, and 5.

      • RawDiskBigBuffer

        public RawDiskBigBuffer(java.lang.String file,
                        java.lang.String md,
                        int sizemb)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Creates a new instance of RawDisk
        Parameters:
        file - - the filename or full path name to the file
        md - Mode of open "r", "rw", "rws" or "rwd" - rwd is recommended
        sizemb - The size of the big buffer to prefetch to in mB
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - If now a "w", then file was not found for reading.

      • readBlockFromRawDisk

        public byte[] readBlockFromRawDisk(int iblk,
                                   int len)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        read starting at blk for len and return as a buffer. Uses readFully so the entire length must be returned. This bypasses the big buffer and does physical I/O to get the data.
        Parameters:
        iblk - the block to start the read
        len - the length of the read
        Returns:
        byte array with data - length is fully read so its always len long.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If seek or read fails.

      • readBlockFromBuffer

        public int readBlockFromBuffer(byte[] b,
                               int iblk,
                               int len,
                               java.lang.String tag)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        read starting at blk for len and return as a buffer, this does not return until the full requested length is read. If the read is past the end of the big buffer, it sleeps until a new buffer is read and the request can be satisfied.
        Parameters:
        b - A buffer to put the data in.
        iblk - the block to start the read
        len - the length of the read
        tag - Some text to include in putput to identify the caller that is blocked
        Returns:
        len if data were read, should block if not
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If seek or read fails.

        Main unit test
        Parameters:
        args - command line args
